channel.title: My personal blog - Taapas Agrawal
channel.description: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

item.title: Git CheatSheet
item.description:
Git(DVCS)

What is Git?

From Git’s official website:

Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

About Version Control

What is version control, and why should you care? Version control is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time so that you can recall specific versions later. Even though the examples in this book show software source code as the files under version control, in reality any type of file on a computer can be placed under version control.

Git install

To check version:

For configuring:

etc.

To display current saved config type –>

For help:

eg:

for help regarding configration process

Creating a local repository:

cd into the directory you want to track and simply type

this will create a .git file in the directory with a basic skeleton without any commits.

To check which files can be commited:

this will list the files that can be commited

  • to ignore files create a .gitignore file using
  • open this using text editor and add names of files you want to ignore

Moving files to staging area

For adding files individually use –>

For adding all files at once use –>

To remove files from staging area use –>

and to remove all simply–>

To commit the files

but it is necessary to add messages with the commit to make sure what we did ; so for that we use “-m” extension like

To check the commit history

Cloning a repository from internet

To clone into current directory use “.” in place of location

To check status of the cloned repository

–> gives the location from where it is fetched

–> gives all the branches

Changing and submitting:

Make changes to the file of the cloned repository.Now to see change made type–>

This will display the change made.

Now git status will view the modified file .

Add the file to the staging area using git add -A

Commit these files with appropriate message .

Now before pushing it back . We need to pull and check whether any other person made a change in the branch since the last time type in –>

(If on master branch else use branchname in place of master)

Now for finally pushing type in –>

Branching:

- To create a new branch–>

  • To check all the branches present –>
  • To switch over branch –>
  • to push a commited change –>

To merge the branch to master

  • To push the changes we simply use –>
  • To check it they are merged type in –>
  • if the branch is successfully merged we can now delete the branch–>

For Reference :

Basic git :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HVsySz-h9r4&t=464s

Resolving a pull request: [https://help.github.com/articles/resolving-a-merge-conflict-using-the-command-line/](https://help.github.com/articles/resolving-a-merge-conflict-using-the-command-line/

item.title: A Craftsman Workshop
